metadata.Title: CVE-2011-4024 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in ocsinventory in OCS Inventory NG 2.0.1 and earlier allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-4024` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ocsinventory-reports - 2.0.5-1.1
ocsinventory-server - 2.0.5-1.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> Per Red Hat bugzilla, 1.3.3 is affected so 1.02.2 is likely affected.

criterions.comment: ocsinventory-server package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.5-1.1').
